This pull request contains a change that will transform Twitter forever. An important optimization has been identified that will significantly improve the performance and scalability of the platform. By implementing this change, a crucial step is being taken towards building a more reliable and efficient Twitter for the future.
The optimization proposed involves restructuring the underlying architecture of Twitter's backend, which will allow for more efficient processing of user data and faster response times. This change will have a significant impact on the platform's ability to handle large volumes of traffic and ensure a seamless user experience.
It is believed that this optimization is a critical and necessary step towards building a better Twitter. The change has been thoroughly tested and is confident in its effectiveness. The community's collaboration is sought to implement this change and usher in a new era of Twitter that is faster, more reliable, and more accessible to all.

Description
This pull request updates the README file for Navi, making several improvements to its structure and content. First, I have moved the README file from its previous location in a nested folder (navi/navi) to the root folder (navi). This change should make it easier to find and access the file, especially for new users who are not familiar with the project's directory structure.
In addition to the structural changes, I have also made several improvements to the grammar and readability of the document. Specifically, I have corrected grammar mistakes and rephrased several sections for clarity. These changes should make the README more accessible and understandable for all users.
Please let me know if you have any feedback or questions about these changes.

This commit adds error handling to the load_data method to catch any exceptions raised by the _reload method. If an exception is caught, the method will print an error message and return None. If the _reload method returns a non-empty DataFrame, the method will return the data. If the data is empty or None, the method will print a message and return None. Additionally, the reload argument has been renamed to reload_data for clarity.

This pull request removes the biased home-mixer module from the codebase. The module has been found to introduce significant biases into the recommendations provided by the home-mixer feature, which could potentially harm the user experience and violate Twitter's policies on fairness and non-discrimination.
To address this issue, we have conducted a thorough analysis of the home-mixer feature and identified the specific areas where bias was being introduced. We have then removed the biased module and made corresponding changes to ensure that the feature is now fair and unbiased for all users.
We believe that this fix will significantly improve the user experience on Twitter and ensure that our platform is accessible and equitable for all. We appreciate your review of this pull request and welcome any feedback or suggestions for further improvements.
